metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0821 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The LIST_POISON feature in include/linux/poison.h in the Linux kernelbefore 4.3, as used in Android 6.0.1 before 2016-03-01, does not properlyconsider the relationship to the mmap_min_addr value, which makes it easierfor attackers to bypass a poison-pointer protection mechanism by triggeringthe use of an uninitialized list entry, aka Android internal bug 26186802,a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-3636.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.3.0-1-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-generic-lpae - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-lowlatency - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc-e500mc - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc-smp - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc64-emb - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-powerpc64-smp - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-extra-4.3.0-1-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.3.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.3.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-1.10').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-1006.6').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
